term.title: phosphines

item.text: PH3 and compounds derived from it by substituting one, two or three hydrogen atoms by hydrocarbyl groups R3P. RPH2 , R2PH and R3P (R ≠ H) are called primary, secondary and tertiary phosphines, respectively. A specific phosphine is preferably named as a substituted phosphane, e.g. CH3PH2 methylphosphane.

sources.item: PAC, 1995, 67, 1307. 'Glossary of class names of organic compounds and reactivity intermediates based on structure (IUPAC Recommendations 1995)' on page 1357 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac199567081307)
